fields.Title: WHIRLING F2 / BROKEN WINDOW VISCAL
fields.Description: A medium Viscal sees the shards are facing outwards.

fields.Title: Visual Calculus: "Something you've done before."
fields.Dialogue Text: Something you've done before.

fields.Title: Visual Calculus: "You mean someone else took your sho..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You mean someone else took your shoe off and smashed the window with it?

fields.Title: Visual Calculus: "What do you mean *assess the damage..."
fields.Dialogue Text: What do you mean *assess the damage*? How would you do that? What are you even trying to do?

fields.Title: Logic: "This person also *forced* the drink..."
fields.Dialogue Text: This person also *forced* the drinks on you.

fields.Title: You: "[Leave.]"
fields.Dialogue Text: [Leave.]

fields.Title: Visual Calculus: "Congratulations, you smashed the wi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Congratulations, you smashed the window with your own shoe.

fields.Title: You: "I'm sure I had a good reason for it..."
fields.Dialogue Text: I'm sure I had a good reason for it. Maybe I was trying to hit someone?

fields.Title: Visual Calculus: "A fine web of scarring covers the b..."
fields.Dialogue Text: A fine web of scarring covers the back of your right hand, but none of it is recent.

fields.Title: Visual Calculus: "Like the green shoe that's on the h..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Like the green shoe that's on the hat rack in the corner, which -- coincidentally -- is missing its friend.

fields.Title: You: "What did this then?"
fields.Dialogue Text: What did this then?

fields.Title: Visual Calculus: "More likely a projectile than a hel..."
fields.Dialogue Text: More likely a projectile than a held object. There are no fragments on the floor from pulling a tool back in after impact.

fields.Title: You: "Assess the damage."
fields.Dialogue Text: Assess the damage.

fields.Title: You: "I should go and get that shoe."
fields.Dialogue Text: I should go and get that shoe.

fields.Title: You: "Look out."
fields.Dialogue Text: Look out.

fields.Title: Visual Calculus: "You mean someone else took your sho..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You mean someone else took your shoe off and smashed the window with it?

fields.Title: Visual Calculus: "The shoe you found out on the balco..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The shoe you found out on the balcony fits the hole almost as well as your foot. It would have also been heavy enough, if thrown with force.

fields.Title: Visual Calculus: "Congratulations, you smashed the wi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Congratulations, you smashed the window with your own shoe. Now you only have one. If you're lucky you can still find the other on the balcony outside. The door to it should be outside your room.

fields.Title: Visual Calculus: "The shards face outward. Whatever b..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The shards face outward. Whatever broke this window came from the inside.

fields.Title: You: "Did I break it with my own hands? (..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Did I break it with my own hands? (Look at them.)

fields.Title: Logic: "This person also *forced* the drink..."
fields.Dialogue Text: This person also *forced* the drinks on you.

fields.Title: Broken Window: "A cool wind gushes in. Your toes cu..."
fields.Dialogue Text: A cool wind gushes in. Your toes curl up from the cold.

fields.Title: You: "Maybe it wasn't me?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Maybe it wasn't me?

fields.Title: You: "Maybe it wasn't me?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Maybe it wasn't me?

fields.Title: You: "Assess the size of the impact."
fields.Dialogue Text: Assess the size of the impact.

fields.Title: Broken Window: "The morning light hurts your eyes...."
fields.Dialogue Text: The morning light hurts your eyes. It's hazy, but you see the ocean and some war-torn buildings...
fields.Alternate1: You see some lights shimmering outside, but it's difficult to make out the outlines of the buildings below -- dark phantoms with many tiny eyes chaotically arranged and not looking at you.

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "Or maybe you were trying to smash y..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Or maybe you were trying to smash your own reflection in the windowpane?

fields.Title: Visual Calculus: "It is too large for a bullet yet to..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It is too large for a bullet yet too small for a piece of furniture. You're looking for something heavy and larger than your fist.

fields.Title: Broken Window: "The window agrees. Its cracked smil..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The window agrees. Its cracked smile is cold and sparkly.

fields.Title: Pain Threshold: "Not that it will keep you warm at n..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Not that it will keep you warm at night. Brrr.

fields.Title: Visual Calculus: "Congratulations, you smashed the wi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Congratulations, you smashed the window with your own shoe.

fields.Title: You: "I don't need it. I don't need *anyo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: I don't need it. I don't need *anyone*.

fields.Title: You: "What a stupid thing to do."
fields.Dialogue Text: What a stupid thing to do.

fields.Title: Visual Calculus: "The single green shoe you found fit..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The single green shoe you found fits the hole almost as well as your foot. It would have also been heavy enough, if thrown with force.

fields.Title: Broken Window: "The window stands broken in its fra..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The window stands broken in its frame. Cold wind blows in.

fields.Title: Visual Calculus: "Congratulations, you smashed the wi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Congratulations, you smashed the window with your own shoe. Now you only have one. If you're lucky, you can still find the other on the balcony outside. The door to it should be outside your room.
fields.Alternate1: Congratulations, you smashed the window with your own shoe. That's why you only have one. If you're lucky, you might still find the other on the balcony outside. The door to it should be outside your room.

fields.Title: You: "Wait, what am I doing?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Wait, what am I doing?

fields.Title: Visual Calculus: "And maybe, just maybe, you succeede..."
fields.Dialogue Text: And maybe, just maybe, you succeeded. We'll never know.

fields.Title: Visual Calculus: "Pretty much. But, hey, at least you..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Pretty much. But, hey, at least you found your shoe.

fields.Title: Visual Calculus: "The shoe you found out on the balco..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The shoe you found out on the balcony fits the hole almost as well as your foot. It's similar to the green shoe that's on the hat rack in the corner, which -- coincidentally -- is missing its friend.
